4. a girl runs a 400 m race in a time of 84 s. in a model of this race, it is assumed that, starting 
from rest, she moves with constant acceleration for 4 s, reaching a speed of 5 m s –1. she 
maintains this speed for 60 s and then moves with constant deceleration for 20 s, crossing 
the finishing line with a speed of v m s –1.
 
(a) sketch, in the space below, a speed-time graph for the motion of the girl during the 
whole race.
(2)
 
(b) find the distance run by the girl in the first 64 s of the race.
(3)
 
(c) find the value of v.
(5)
 
(d) find the deceleration of the girl in the final 20 s of her race.
(2)

by the support at q.
 
by modelling the plank as a uniform rod, and the child and the block as particles,
